conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of changing light source position.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light; size and position depend on light source position relative to object and surface.
Moving light source downward affects size and position of shadows.
As light source moves closer, angle of light rays increases, causing shadows to become larger.
Position of shadows will shift closer to objects as light rays fall more directly beneath them.
Shadow A (Ice Cream) will become larger and move closer to the base of the ice cream.
Shadow B (Typewriter) will become larger and move closer to the typewriter.
Shadow C (Sphere) will become larger and move closer to the sphere.
Shadow D (CD) will become larger and move closer to the CD.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become larger and move closer to their respective objects.
